Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; on top: palmette and lotus cross with added red on kalyxes and petals; around edges: ivy leaf frieze with alternating black and red leaves; underside reserved except for part of black band where handle joins krater; drill hole for repair at handle join on one side.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 24)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 283, no. B250)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0968)
